word: I was instructed that there was danger of Dr. [J. H.] Kellogg becoming unsettled in regard to the truth, that he was not standing firm upon the true foundation. He has labored so hard to make the medical missionary work the whole body that he has lost sight of the spirit of the message.--Letter 214, 1903, pp. 2, 3. (To P. T. Magan and E. A. Sutherland, October 9, 1903.)
